com.beaglebuddy.id3.pojo

Class Price

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.beaglebuddy.id3.pojo.Price

  • public class Price
extends java.lang.Object

    An ID3v2.x price consists of a currency and an amount.

    Price Fields
     FieldDescription
    1. Currencycurrency of the price.
    2. amount The amount uses the "." character as the decimal point.

    Some examples of a price are:

    • USD0.99
    • EUR1.00
    • GBP0.65

      • Price

      • Price

        public Price(Currency currency,
             java.lang.String amount)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        constructor.
        Parameters:
        currency - the ISO-4217 currency code.
        amount - the amount of the price using "." as the decimal point.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the amount is not a valid amount. That is, if the amount is not in the form "^\d+\.?\d*$"
        See Also:
        setAmount(String)

      • setAmount

        public void setAmount(java.lang.String amount)
        set the amount of the price. The amount must coform to the regular expression: ^\d+\.?\d*$
        This means the amount must start with a digit, followed by an optional decimal point, followed by 0 or more digits.
        .
        Examples of valid amounts include:
        • 1
        • 1.
        • 1.0
        • 1.50
        • 0.50

        Examples of invalid amounts include:
        • +1
        • -1.50
        • .50
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of the price using "." as the decimal point.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the amount is not a valid amount. That is, if the amount is not in the form "^\d+\.?\d*$"
        See Also:
        getAmount()

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        get a string representation of a price.
        Overrides:

        Returns:
        a string representation of a price.
